SEARCH
Package com.example.closetics.clothes

Class ClothesManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.closetics.clothes.ClothesManager
public class ClothesManager extends Object
Clothes manager is a helper class with public static methods. It takes care of adding endpoint requests to the volley request queue for the /clothes endpoint.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • saveClothingRequest

      public static void saveClothingRequest(android.content.Context context, ArrayList<androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<String>> fragments, long userId, String URL, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<org.json.JSONObject> responseListener, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
      Sends a Volley POST request to save a piece of clothing to the backend controller.

      This method collects clothing attributes from a list of MutableLiveData fragments, builds a JSON object, and submits it via a POST request to the provided URL.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access the Volley request queue
      fragments - a list of MutableLiveData containing clothing data:
      • 0 - favorite (yes/no)
      • 1 - size
      • 2 - color
      • 3 - date bought
      • 4 - price
      • 5 - item name
      • 6 - brand
      • 7 - material
      userId - the ID of the user saving the clothing item
      URL - the base URL of the server endpoint (without "/createClothing")
      responseListener - callback for handling a successful server response
      errorListener - callback for handling a server error or network failure

    • deleteClothingRequest

      public static void deleteClothingRequest(android.content.Context context, Long clothingId, String URL, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<String> responseListener, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
      Sends a volley DELETE request to the backend controller deleting the clothing item.

      This method collects the clothing ID of the item to be deleted along with the proper URL endpoint and deletes the specified clothing item from the database using a by creating a String Request.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access the Volley request queue
      clothingId - the ID of the piece of clothing being deleted
      URL - the URL of the server endpoint
      responseListener - callback for handling a successful server response
      errorListener - callback for handling a server error or network failure

    • updateClothingRequest

      public static void updateClothingRequest(android.content.Context context, org.json.JSONObject updateObject, String URL, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<org.json.JSONObject> responseListener, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
      Sends a volley PUT request to the backend controller to update a clothing item.

      This method collects a clothing object and updates the object in the backend at the same clothing ID to fit the attributes of the new object by creating a JSONObjectRequest.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access the Volley request queue
      updateObject - the updated JSON object to replace the current clothing item
      URL - the URL of the server endpoint
      responseListener - callback for handling a successful server response
      errorListener - callback for handling a server error or network failure

    • getClothingByUserRequest

      public static void getClothingByUserRequest(android.content.Context context, long userId, String URL, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<org.json.JSONArray> responseListener, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
      Volley GET request to retrieve a list of specific users clothing items

      This method collects a user ID to grab all clothing items belonging to that user via a JSONArrayRequest.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access the Volley request queue
      userId - the ID of the user of who's clothes are to be viewed
      URL - the base URL of the server endpoint (without "/getClothing/user/")
      responseListener - callback for handling a successful server response
      errorListener - callback for handling a server error or network failure

    • getClothingRequest

      public static void getClothingRequest(android.content.Context context, long clothingId, String URL, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<org.json.JSONObject> responseListener, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
      Sends a Volley GET request to retrieve one clothing item.

      This method collects a clothing ID and returns the JSON object associated with that clothing ID via a JSONObjectRequest.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access the Volley request queue
      clothingId - the ID of the piece of clothing to retrieved
      URL - the URL of the server's endpoint
      responseListener - callback for handling a successful server response
      errorListener - callback for handling a server error or network failure

    • getClothingByTypeRequest

      public static void getClothingByTypeRequest(android.content.Context context, long userId, String URL, long type, com.android.volley.Response.Listener<org.json.JSONArray> responseListener, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
      Sends a Volley GET request to retrieve clothing items of a specific type for a user.

      This method collects the user ID and the clothing type ID to fetch a list of clothing items that match the specified type, using a JsonArrayRequest.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access the Volley request queue
      userId - the ID of the user whose clothing items are to be retrieved
      URL - the base URL of the server endpoint (without "/type/{userId}/{type}")
      type - the type ID of the clothing items to retrieve
      responseListener - callback for handling a successful server response
      errorListener - callback for handling a server error or network failure

    • nullCheck

      public static void nullCheck(String header, Object parameter, org.json.JSONObject object) throws org.json.JSONException
      Utility method to safely add a key-value pair to a JSONObject.

      This method checks if the provided parameter is not null before inserting it into the given JSONObject under the specified header name. If the parameter is null, the key-value pair is not added.

      Parameters:
      header - the key under which the value should be stored
      parameter - the value to store in the JSONObject
      object - the JSONObject to which the key-value pair will be added
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if there is an error adding data to the JSONObject
